lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. Before we dive into tonight's episode, we have some announcements to get through, so hang tight for just a moment. We have two fantastic sponsors for tonight's episode, the first, of course, our fantastic returning friends and allies in this Campaign Two: D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, I really think, guys, that this bit has been a journey for all of us, and I feel like we've all learned something about ourselves, and about-- Nope, I'm being told we have not learned anything, and that I'm to wrap it up, so back to you, Matt!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to recycle all those papers, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shadows in the Forest is the only collaborative board game that you actually play in the dark. In the game you play as Shadowlings, they're these scattered gnomish-like creatures that hide in the shadows and live in the forest, and it's really cool. You all have to work together to try and meet under a singular tree on the board while one of the players plays as a lantern, an actual physical lantern that gives off light, and so you can only move within the shadows, and if the player moves the light--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's really cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I brought a copy, actually, I forgot to bring it out onto the table, but I have a copy that we'll probably play.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's really cool, because if you're playing one of the shadows and you're caught in the light, you can't move, and if the person who's playing the light manages to catch all the Shadowlings in the light, they win, but if all the Shadowlings manage to meet under there-- It actually uses--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They did a creepy animation for a promo that's during the break.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's got little stand-up trees, and the little creatures are very Miyazaki-looking, and the whole thing's got a very Candyland for goth kids vibe. The dice glow, which I also think is really cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty fun. So you can check it out on Amazon, and it's currently at 20% off there for a limited time, so make sure to pick up your copy now if you plan to. It is Shadows in the Forest, and it is awesome and I'm really excited to try it out. Next up, lets see, Travis do you want to go ahead and talk a little bit about Operation Supply Drop?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! Operation Supply Drop is my charity that we are supporting this November in honor of Veterans Day. OSD is an amazing charity. They've helped over 750,000 members of the military community. In active service, in their transition back to civilian life, they help the families of the people that have served. These guys are so great. They have skill fairs, they help people with job training, resumes, anything that'll take them from being a military back into the real world. To me, it's so personal. My family has been in the military for, oh god, decades. So if you can, share with your friends and family, give a little love. Everything you need to know about the charity, or just donate, is at critrole.com/osd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys for your amazing support of this initiative. It's been awesome to watch all the Critters come together to help support our troops there. It's been awesome. We also have a bunch of new live content coming to our Critical Role Twitch stream in the next few weeks, including the season finale of All Work No Play.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my goodness!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I've seen clips and I'm already pretty excited.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Very, very, very special.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've been doing this a while. It might be the weirdest thing I've produced. It's frickin weird. Yeah, whole thing's bizarre.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All-honey Honey Heist.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it all honey plus Brian Foster, or just all honeys?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope, just all honeys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All the ladies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Honey Heist! Honey, Honey Heist!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Laura, of course, some old friends: Mary Elizabeth and Noelle Stevenson

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Some classics, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's some heavy She-Ra juice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So much power at one table. Wow!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As well as the lovely Dani Carr that we all know and love. The lovely Brittany Walloch from All Work No Play fame.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've heard of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who else am I missing, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Isn't Krystina playing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh and Krystina Arielle from Sirens of the Realms.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Full house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We also have Sam's Pablove fireside chat coming up soon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh that's right, I have to do a fireside chat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you doing that in a speedo, or what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, he promised to free-ball it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And much more. Go to critrole.com for details of all these fantastic shows that are coming up in the next couple of weeks. We'll have more updates as far as our content schedule as it comes. Also, our second art book, as you mentioned, Chronicles of Exandria Volume II: Legend of the Vox Machina is available for pre-order at the shop at shop.critrole.com and shop.critrole.co.uk for our UK and surrounding European brethren. An important note, if you do

lines.name: UKUS
lines.text: This is a big love letter to the end of last campaign, and each of you having something really special to come to make this a memorable keepsake for all of us. So thank you. As a reminder, there will not be an episode of Critical Role next week because it's Thursday November 22nd, which is Thanksgiving here in the US.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Going to eat food!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, I know. We will be enjoying time off with our family and friends, but we will be thinking of you guys in the meantime and we will be back the week after that. So there'll be a one week break, we'll see you in two weeks after tonight's episode. I believe those are all--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got something!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! Sneaky Laura!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's not on the thing, but I have it anyway. Are you wearing it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I am!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have our hoodies, back in stock in shop.critrole.com. It's new and improved. Yeah, 2.0. This really awesome text was hand calligraphed? Calli-- how do you say it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Calligraphed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I say it right? By Chris Gladis and then we turned it into this graphic, and so it's really gorgeous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Critter calligraphed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! And it's super soft still.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's so nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then the other thing that's in the store now that we didn't tell you guys about ahead of time is something I'm very excited about. We have baby onesies! There's not a ton of them because how many Critter babies are there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thousands!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I designed this one, it says, "I wanna be a monstah!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look at the little rattle mace!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's got a mace rattle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also viable for our really small critters, too. I think Sam will fit in one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We will certainly try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In fact for the fireside chat we could--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, maybe I can just wear that. That's a good idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. Wow. You guys are ever creative. Last we left off. The Mighty Nein-- Garbage wine?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Garbage wine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Made your way back across the Lucidian Ocean, towards the city of Darktow. Actually actively partook in some piracy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Polite piracy

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Polite piracy. Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got a participant trophy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever it takes to help you sleep at night. And found yourselves at the pirate city of Darktow, surrounded by the Dragshallow Reef. Where you had just arrived, with both ships, the Squalleater and The Mistake. The crew you had hired out of Nicodranas, looking very confused and concerned at their current fate, given the fact they were just hired hands at sea. You were ushered up along the sheer cliffs alongside Darktow Isle, a long stone shelf within the cavern where the Plank King himself greeted you, bid you entry to the Revelry, this extending band of pirates across this part of the ocean. Laid some ground rules and sent you on your way. And that is where we left off. Mighty Nein, as you descend the rain-covered stone steps that descend down the side of the cliffs-- how's that for alliteration in a phrase? Making your way towards the now-darkened evening city of Darktow, the distant glimmers of interior firelight slightly emanating from open windows. You can see folks walking through town, the light drizzle threatening to stifle the low torchlight being carried from location to location. You can see the outline of dozens of ships that are locked into the shipyard that surrounds the city, as well as the crooked outline of nearby barricades set up across the reefs that surround the island. Avantika proceeds before you. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Shoot her in the back of the head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) We could totally push her off the cliff right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Uk'otoa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, so, the group is us plus Avantika and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Her crew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just Avantika. Her crew went to The Bloated Cup, which is a tavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we're headed there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You assume you're headed back there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pirate on pirate violence is verboten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She just slipped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I saw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She fell down the stairs, you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Night time, right? Sun has gone down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I catch up to her a little bit. Hey, Avantika.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Weird question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Possibly a weird answer."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much do you know-- How do you know how to give a certain amount to Avantika? Sorry, the Plank King. Freudian slip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, when we return into the bay, we are to essentially give the materials, or at least a "number of what we've managed to acquire. We are supposed to, essentially-- what is the word I'm "looking for? What is the word I'm looking for?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tithe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tithe, I would say-- You're going through customs and you have to--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Declare.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Declare, thank you. "You must declare the amount of which you have recently come upon, and "from that there is a tithe offer to the Plank King, roughly about 25-30%. But we do not pay for "our ship repairs, we have free asylum here within the island, and we are under the strict law that "if anyone double-crosses anyone else within the bounds of the city, they will have the hammer of "the Plank King down upon them."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very intense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is the way of life."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's less like a government and more of a union that you buy into?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "More or less, yes. They're not much into governing, more just--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a union with a dictator?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A union with a very hard-headed and forthright union leader."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Hmm. Do you ever think you could make a good union leader?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nah. I have my own specific interests, they're much more narrow."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why, do you have aspirations?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't think so."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who needs aspirations?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, some of us do. There has to be more to you than just this "contradictory-for-the-sake-of-being-contradictory aspect, eh?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would love for you to tell me about it someday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Come, let's have a drink, huh? First round's on me."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Everyone's fucking Avantika!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are going to judge me for finger motions? Hold on, everybody, stop the game. Laura Bailey just shamed me for a sexual finger motion, at this table, after three and a half motherfucking years! I have seen everything! Resume the game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or does she?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, she lost a stone, technically.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well. We should take a look around, maybe get a sense of this place, since we're going to be here for a while when they fix the ship. I have a few things I'm looking for.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might as well go to the pub.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could do that, sure, I guess.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First drink's on her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that guy was wearing a wig.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, he did have a weird hairline, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it was a really bad-made wig. I mean, the hair looked good, but it was really obvious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe that's in fashion here, maybe we should all go wig shopping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just saying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Captain, how did the current Plank King get to the position that he holds now, do you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I have been told, at the very least-- this was before my time joining the "Revelry-- there was a disagreement, and the previous Plank King seemed to be in the minority "of the side of this disagreement, and the current Plank King was in the majority. So they stormed "the caverns of the previous Plank King, and tossed most of his corpse to the rocks below."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Interesting. No, that's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To his credit, the current Plank King has done a very fine job of maintaining organization "in the Revelry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I was going to ask: if you were a fan or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He doesn't bother me, he leaves us well enough alone, we follow the rules, we maintain "all of the benefits of being under the banner, and I'm left to my own devices."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any foes of yours in this Darktow? Anyone we should look out for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are a number of unsavory types, but I've made a bit of a reputation of being a "little-- eh? People don't like to tangle with that too much, eh?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, why would you get wrapped up in that? Yeah, let's go grab a drink.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long have you been a pirate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's see. Open on the seas? About 12, 13 years."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How did you fall into it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I got sick of following somebody else's orders."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where do you hail from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll tell you over drinks. This is not the best place to have these discussions, eh? Perhaps "after a few rounds. Come! To The Bloated Cup!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Bloated Cup.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. We go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys finish descending the stairs into the city itself, you catch there are quite a few patrols through the city. You can see the torchlight being held by each as they make their way, just keeping an eye out. You get the sense that there's probably quite a number of volunteers, or at least individuals, that are intent on maintaining the semblance of civility here within Darktow itself. Leading close towards The Bloated Cup, it's not that far from where you had set your ship within the shipyard. It's a fairly large two-story tavern, very wide across its bottom, and seems to be at least one of maybe two social gathering sites here within the city, once the sun goes down. Three blocks away, you can already hear the music, chatter, laughter, and yelling. As you approach closer, begin to look from the outside in, the warm light and the movement of shadows across the open windows shows you that the place is pretty jam-packed. As you begin to make your way into, following Avantika, to the interior, you hear the shouting and burbling and clinking of glasses as the far corner has five or six individuals. You're not sure if they're paid musicians, or just sailors who happen to have a bit of experience with a fiddle, a drum, and a flute of some kind. As the music begins to play, you can see there is one table that has a lot of Avantika's crew. They've pushed a bunch of chairs clammed together-- clammed?-- crammed together with some bits of dried bread and somewhat soft fruit, some cheeses laid out, and two large pitchers of ale already waiting at the get-go. Right off from them, you see a smaller table with everyone you've hired from The Mistake, including Orly, all sitting there clutching their glasses looking around scared shitless. As soon as you enter, their eyes turn to you and they go-- (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They do that cafeteria thing, "Hey! Hey, you want to sit? Over here?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point Avantika goes, "Come! Have a seat!" and pushes one of the other tables out of the way of a few other people that are already sitting at it. She takes her hand and scoots it across the table and they both go, (annoyed grunt), and spit on the ground and get up and move away. Immediately you get the sense that there is a power dynamic. Avantika seems to have at least some modicum of respect amongst the rest of the riff-raff within this tavern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's a Heather.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (knowing laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing the tables together, kicking a couple of the stools over, it looks like there's enough spots at the table for most of you. One or two of you might have to stand or find a place next to the rest of your hired help.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll stand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll stand, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all sit down, drinks and rounds begin to be passed to each of you, conversations already mid-discussing. You hear bits and pieces about how, "the blessing of the Serpent has been "upon us this past month." Being on the ship with most of the crew, they haven't been terribly social with you. They've helped you and guided you in learning a few things, but there's still very much this separation and attention that you're the newcomers, and a strange, new shiny thing in their captain's eye. This is the first time you've seen them a little bit three sheets to the wind as a group, and they're talking openly. Avantika has a definite zealotry to her, but you start noticing members of the crew and why they are with her or, at least, now that they've been there, they've also bought into these tales of Uk'otoa. You get the sense that they believe that this path that she's following will lead to her success and, by default, probably their success.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many of them are true believers? Give or take?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check for me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're no good at those, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm terrible at these.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to know what blood type they are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also feel that Ipess, who's the gnome second mate that you've encountered previously, in a very similar way is completely invested, eyes wide. His general banter tends to be a little crazed and sporadic, but whenever they're talking about the Great Serpent, now with phrasing of "The Leviathan" as the title has become more prominent with discovery, there's a reverence to his eyes and an attentiveness that is out of character for him. So you mark Vera and Ipess as two very intent believers, behind Avantika.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there anybody who's awkwardly into it, but definitely would probably walk away if they could? Is there anybody who's a little--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that Bouldergut, the ogre, half-understands it and is more just excited because everyone else is excited. It's like a dog that gets really wound up when everyone around is talking loud. That's Bouldergut. A number of the deckhands appear to be invested, but they're less intensely driven and more just excited that their captain's excited and maybe starting to consider that there is something to this now that they've seen the things they've seen, and the powers that she's acquired. That's a good spread of what you've managed to gather.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll grab a drink and I'll head over to where Vera's sitting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Vera is sitting directly to the right of Avantika, and there's not much space to sit next to her, but you could grab a stool and squeeze in to her right side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take a drink and I'll plop it down right in front of her and I'll take a knee on the floor, so I'm kneeling next to her on the other side of Avantika. I'll say: Hey listen, no hard feelings, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is no hard feelings. I understand the reasoning, and the captain's word is law. I am "excited to see the great things you accomplish as the quartermaster of our ship."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, whatever's best for the ship.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Precisely, and for the captain."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I feel the presence of Uk'otoa smiling on all of us and I know that our partnership here will be a beneficial one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can only agree."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, this has been fun. If you need anything, as your quartermaster, you just let me know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Big mutton chops that come down to a very pointed chin, and he's dressed in fairly decent clothing, a nice silk vest with billowing sleeves out of his shirt, with some bangles that clink around his wrists. He comes and finds you on the opposite side and looks across to Avantika grinning. He goes, "Well well well, it's been a while since "we've seen you 'round here!" She turns to him and goes, "Ah, Sorris! You're back from that fool's "errand, I see. How was the Shattered Teeth?" He goes, "Eh, foggy and cold as shit. How goes your "cloud-chasing journeys, love?" She goes, "Grand! We might have scored a fine shipwreck, and a "promise of salvage, eh?" Looks back to him. "You up for hire, perhaps?" He goes, "Eh, tempting but, "nah. I'm still fresh off the water, want to enjoy myself a while." She's like, "All right, very "well, we'll be in port for a day or two while we get some repairs done. If you change your mind, "well, just start shouting. I'm sure we'll find your annoying voice easy enough." He goes, "(giggles) Sure that is, eh? You're all new 'round here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Arr!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we're new pirates. Are you a pirate? I mean, I guess we're all pirates, right? Everyone's a pirate here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At the moment, no. At the moment I'm a civilian, and a drunkard."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shattered Teeth, what's the Shattered Teeth? Did your teeth shatter? Is that a place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it's a series of islands to the south of here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We know that because we're pirates too, and we know those things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could fill a book with what I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, I didn't catch your name, it was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorris. Sorris Kay. What's your name?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I'm Fjord. Nice to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fjord? All right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you a captain, or do you do something else that's more specialized?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Me? No, I'm a sniper."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A sniper?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you snipe with?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Things. Why are you so curious?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're an interesting fellow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Speak for yourself, sir. What's your name?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My name is Phillip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Name check!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Strong name.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is that? I don't have my contacts in. I can barely see it. That's 11, right? So that is 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Okay, Phillip, and what's your specialty? What do you bring to the crew?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I am a navigator. Newer, but eager and looking forward to plying my trade.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quick, Phillip, which way's north?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's right that way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's actually pretty good!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can spin him. Here! I'm going to spin him around a couple times. Now which way's north?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still over toward the hallway over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's pretty good. Me, I've got a few odds and things, mainly with a longbow. Good shot "there, but an eye that can see things on the horizon, mainly live up in the crow's nest, you "know? Keep an eye out."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, this is our first time on these islands and I don't know much about it at all. Is there any legal system here? Do you know what I mean? Or is it just, you know-- (gunshots)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's joking, right?" Avantika goes, "I'm afraid not. His bailiwick, apparently, is being "curious and clueless."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am a big reader and there is a lot I don't know, like my tall friend over here. I mean, there must be trouble that breaks out. There must be bar fights.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, bar fights are fun. That's part of the reason we live here!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I can see the appeal, but what happens if there's something risky or it causes theft of property for someone important?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If it's a member of the Revelry thieving from another member of the Revelry, and it gets found out, it's brought to Plank King. Plank King makes a judgment, based on that, some sort of reparations or-- (thud, screaming, impacts)"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So Plank King is the law?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "More or less."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's biblical.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you can still fight other people? For fun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why? You looking for a fight?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you looking for a fight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Always."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't fight each other!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because that's crazy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I never throw the first punch, so anytime." He taps the side of one of his jowls. You hear the ruffle of his fingers through his somewhat curled muttonchop on the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabs a drink and without breaking eye contact--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We just got here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why? Why would you do this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm the worst influence. I'm going to say do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are trying to get the lay of the land here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tusktooth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (gulping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I punch him in the chin!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You didn't even ask him if there's a bookshop nearby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Might have gotten to that, perhaps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unarmed strike! 14? No, 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits. You do one point of damage plus your strength modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Four points of damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Boom, right across his chin. He falls to the ground, turns around, rubs his chin. "That was a surprising bit of power there for someone your size. Come at me!" He dives at you. Roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, he beats you at a 17. 15 plus two. For a small size, he is quick and he jukes to one side, turns around, and goes for a haymaker to the side of your face! That's cocked. That's a 14 to hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I turn and he hits my shield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ping! "Ah!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I swipe at him with my tail and try to trip him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Make another attack roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you just doing damage or are you trying to shove him and knock him prone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just knock him prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that's your athletics check, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay, so I would add 13 plus athletics.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's going to make his acrobatics to try and dodge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 19. He manages to leap in the air and your tail hits the side of the table and (thudding) to one side. The drinks begin to spill and one reaches out and grabs them, prevents them from being knocked over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all grabbing our drinks and standing up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, you're quick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you turn back and say that, you look and he's not anywhere to be seen. Then you hear this (footsteps) under the table. You glance down as you watch him leaping up from between your legs and the table to uppercut you right in the chin. That's 18 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He just manages to hit you! You take three points of damage. Crack! Right from underneath the chin, you feel your jaw clink into your teeth, there's a horrible screeching sound. It hurts. You can feel the numbness in your face from the impact. After he hits you, he darts off around from behind and he's probably going to go in for a hold, but you have your go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to reach out and try to punch him in the back of the head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Inelegant, but perfect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 19 to hit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Crack! Right in the front of the forehead and the nose, you can immediately feel the blood beginning to pour from underneath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crikey.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few of them are now backing up and getting their drinks, ready to watch. Somebody else at the table goes (impacts) and punches somebody else and starts another aspect, and now there's another bar fight beginning down the side corner. It's your go. Oh, wait. Yeah, because he finished the heatbutt, so you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much damage was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three points of damage. Every time you get hit, he does three points.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. Oh, no, should I be mean?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Should I be mean?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to grab him after he hits my head and I'm going to try to knee him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. Roll for an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good, that's 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that definitely hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Four points of damage right between the legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another four points there. All right. "Ugh!" His eyes squint and roll backwards a bit and he goes down into a crouching position. (grunting) Rights himself in almost a Muay Thai stance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Below the belt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's 11. He tries to swing and you parry it off to the side without an issue. Go ahead and retort.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to grab his wrist and try to spin him around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! I'm going to grab him and try to grab both of his arms and hold him on to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're grappling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll again for your athletics.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, that was really bad. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now holding him to you; he's grabbed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say uncle, say uncle!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, natural 18, that's a 24. Take another three points of damage. Crack! It hits you. For a second, you're afraid it knocked a tooth out, but you feel with your tongue and it's still there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I still have a hold of him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's still grappled.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, ooh, I'm going to turn my head and try to hit him with my horn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, nice, roll for an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that was cocked. Crazy cocked. 19!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 hits, takes another four damage. Crack! It scrapes across his temple and it almost gouges an eye, and he turns and he's like, "Ah! You're rambunctious, aren't you?" He's going to attempt to throw you off over his shoulder, pull you into a roll. You get to make an athletics or acrobatics check against him as he tries to break from your grapple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got one gold on the blue one. Anyone want one gold on the blue one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take that bet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now prone from the reversal, but it's your round, so you can get up or attack if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I do a breakdancing move where I spin around and jump up? Like Arya did in that episode of Game of Thrones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who? Did you say Mario?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Arya.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's Avantika doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's drinking and watching. One leg up on the table and she's glancing over, watching this transpire. You're going to sweep as you get up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 does not hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You sweep and he leaps up and then, from the air, tries to come down onto your leg with the full force of his tiny gnomish body. Natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Blood's leaking out of his nose and his mouth and it's smeared on one side of his cheek and he's (chuckling).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're crazy, Sorris. I like you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I like you too--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Boom! Right in the face. 16 to hit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural one. The sheer impact of the last blow seems to have knocked his block off, and he starts doing this series of pummeling in the wrong direction, instead pushing toward Caduceus. He moves out of the way. He batters at the side of his sleeve there and, "Ha! How's that? Did I get her? Wait." Looks around and finds you. "Hi." Your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to say: All right, all right, all right. We're friends now, okay? Let's not do any real damage to each other. I'm going to pat his head and cast Cure Wounds.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're awwing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's on the edge, finish him!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 1st-level.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have mashed his hair spikes down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is six points of healing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's two punches taken away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One and a half.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're friends now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "Huh. Thank you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Ooh, 21?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks at you for a second. "Yeah. Good point. I could've taken you anyway."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We'll pick this up another day."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Hey! I made a friend!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you did. Good job, Jester!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and you kept all your teeth.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Pirates!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He comes up and goes for a handshake, grabs your hand, pulls you and gives you a soft headbutt. It's a little sore on both of you and both of you wince. "Pleasure to meet you. What's "your name?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Little Sapphire. That's my pirate name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. Sorris. Pleasure to meet you as well." As you guys are having this conversation, you hear behind you (grunting, crashing). Another table behind is broken and you can see a person unconscious across the shattered pieces of wood, arms curled in t-rex style.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, unconscious person down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! I'm going to go steal from them. Oh, wait, no, you can't do that on this island.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that Blues Traveler?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is the Traveler.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crowd goes, (cheering). Everyone who was mildly disappointed at the lack of finale to your fight has now focused on the other one that has completed with the smashing of furniture, the person on there left scrapped up and wrecked. The other individual, one eye swollen shut, square-jawed, burly-looking guy going, "Yeah!" Everyone cheers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the rest of Avantika's crew doing? Are they in the scrap as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're just watching. The scrap was only between two or three people, and one of them just went down. The other one called it off after that and the declared winner everyone's briefly focusing on. Then as fast as everyone cared, everyone sat back down and they're back to drinking. You get the sense in that moment this is not a rare occurrence around here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hourly flare-up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like someone ordered a special at an extremely expensive tiki bar.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Uk'otoa, Uk'otoa, Uk'otoa, huh!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, where the fuck did you guys just go? I hope we're going there after this show.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Go to Trader Sam's.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where that mug came from!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's why I have my tiki mug today.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb brings a big mug of ale and sits down close to Avantika and says, over this din: This is a big longshot, but you seem very well-traveled and well-researched. This place is crazy, but any place worth its salt has books. Why are you laughing at me? Why are you laughing at me? Such a straightforward question. Well, I can tell from your reaction that there is probably no good place to acquire a book, but you seem more educated than the normal sort-- or people around me-- so perhaps you have a suggestion for a scholar lost at sea?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is a very curious question. I imagine there are probably some books. That wouldn't be "what is commonly considered contraband or heavy resale value. Most of the time when you are "boarding a ship, you leave the books behind. If you're looking for books, your best bet is to go "to the Sundry Square during the day."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sundry Square, during the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's about four blocks to the left after you leave the outside of here, just outside of the "shipyard. It's where all the awnings and ships are."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should I be checking the trash bins for these, then? Or do you think someone might actually have them for sale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You can certainly ask around. Maybe both, I don't know."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm jonesing pretty badly for a good book.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm looking for a blacksmith, actually, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is possibly a few around, if I recall."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worth their salt. Somebody worth their salt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just taken with the saying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's going to use that a lot? That phrase?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's worth my salt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, how much is salt worth to you? Like on a scale of money to nothing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like a person's worth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I don't know. I haven't really thought about it at all, now that I think about it. That's a good question. I mean, there's so much salt around, to be fair. It would probably take a lot of salt to be worth something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, you could get it right out of the water.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's a fairly benign saying. Don't get too lost in it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything is worth its salt at that point, really. It's a terrible currency.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did he drink a lot?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was wondering how empty that cup is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has anyone been watching me drink?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to ask.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have been nursing the same cup the entire time and have been fake-sipping it the entire night. I haven't actually had a drop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You had an ale or whatever everybody else is drinking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever they handed me. I've been doing this, to be fair, the entire time we've been together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's Bruce Wayne! Caduceus Wayne.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus Wayne?

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Caduce Wayne!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I elbow Fjord and I sit down next to Avantika.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh jeez, take my chair, fine. I'll go get another.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's next for The Squalleater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well," and she sits, looks around everyone at the table, and gestures for everyone to lean in a bit. "It looks like we are to, after a couple of days of travel and supply-gathering, make our way "northward to a location that has been brought to my attention by our quartermaster. There is a "likely chance that if there is some sort of treasure there, it would be of importance to our "mission. However, it is a salvage mission, meaning there will be some diving. So I am looking for a "few things to prepare for that so a few of us can comfortably make our way beneath the waves."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Into the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beneath the water, my friend."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do cannon-folk typically go on those trips, or do cannon-folk typically stay behind with the ship?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gunner master, Nott, gunner master.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gunner master.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is up to you. You are welcome to stay behind. However, if things go correctly, I don't "think there will be any worry of drowning."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. How can you promise that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nevertheless--" At this point she looks up at somebody past you and goes, "We're having a private discussion." You turn and follow her eye line and you see a human female with curled blonde hair. The curls have fallen in the moisture and the rain from the outside, dressed in a thick, ragged, black coat, holding a cup, and she goes, "Aye, don't worry about me. Just didn't expect this shore to drag you in quite so soon." There's a moment of tension.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we recognize her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both stare for a second, and she turns and walks off to a far table.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was she directing that towards Avantika?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who was that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? What did she say? Haven't heard-- didn't expect this-- what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't mind her. It's Allison; she's-- what's the word? A right cunt."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not Heather. Make a note.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Friend of yours, or former friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, best of friends. No, just a very nosy co-thief at sea. Doesn't know where to stop poking "where it doesn't belong."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Former business associate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, former competitor. Anyway."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I immediately grab my purse and hold onto it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What purse?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The thing I imagine most adventurers have. A little coin satchel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but not like a cute little--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not a Dolce & Gabbana, no. Not a Kate Spade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You mean a competitor in terms of sea space, or in terms of your faith?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, we've crossed territories once or twice, and she has a habit of trying to embellish "truths to the Plank King. Anyway." Hand me the map, if you don't mind. Oh, map's here, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I knew someone like that once. They would always go fishing and say that they caught something, but they never did.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A fisherman?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika lays a map out on the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, we'll put our weights down to weigh it down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, there was a discussion. It's coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Coasters are not heavy enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here's a cube. Have a cube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A cube will do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a cube.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a cube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Avantika points it out, she shows the crew and says, "In two days travel, we will make "our way outside of the Dragshallow Reef, coasting in northward for protection to about here. We "begin looking for our salvage." At which point, Orly, who's glancing over the side, rubs his chin and goes, "Hmm. I don't mean to question the captain's m-m-main objective; however, that looks "like it's right around where the Diver's Grave m-m-may be."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Diver's Grave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks back and goes, "Perhaps, but does it spook you? Do ghost stories make you shiver, "turtle boy?" Orly glances back at her with a narrowed stare and goes, "As long as I'm staying "on the ship, I don't m-m-mind." He goes and sits back down at the table.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do divers die there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Sorris goes, "Oh, is that where you're going? You're going over to the "Diver's Grave?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It would appear so, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that's certainly an off-limits location for most salvaging, thanks to the cursed "woman, eh? Do you know much about your history?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm hoping this is a place where somebody named Rachel Diver may have bought a piece of land or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Close, but not at all."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, or Sophie. It's always a Sophie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check. You can with disadvantage, because of your lack of experience with the naval history.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would I have heard ghost stories?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a history check as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't quite catch your attention. You've heard mention of the Diver's Grave, as it was a series of poems from a book you once read. The thing that comes to mind is the name Dashilla. You instinctively mouth it-- Dashilla-- and he goes, "Ah, Dashilla the Dreadful. You know about this one, eh?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I read a poem about her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah. Poem, I've not known, but maybe the song you've heard." Some of the crew around nod, remembering, and he goes and grabs his cup and claps it twice to the table, and the crew begins to filter in as the song progresses, and he goes--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If there's not 12 people that pop out behind this curtain, I'm going to be disappointed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was waiting for him to go, "Bill Murray."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (applause)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! That's fortuitous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Her hungry eye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Her claws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Her lantern light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't she have a ring or something that you said in the song?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I heard something about a ring, and treasure in her eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks confused, "So you don't know the poem or the song."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I know it, I just didn't-- I mean, I read it like, one time, a long time ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you want a reprisal?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (clears throat, singing) "Where once the waters rolled calmly by, where ocean's heart did "sing. There stalked a lass with a hungry eye, and claws that grasp and wring. With lantern lure of a "glimmer pot, with treasure in their eyes. Below they swam to the gold they thought would await "them as their prize. Yet each of them went to surely die, their graves to not be found. For "Dashilla and her hungry eye collects the lost and drowned."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Single eye, huh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anyone else getting a bad feeling about that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, why would you ever get a bad feeling about that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (record scratching) Remix!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (low-pitched) Break it, break it, break it down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Her hungry eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "But that's just an old wives' tale, you know? A myth."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorris, is that somewhere you've been to? You seem like a very fortune-seeking type.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I sail over it, we just don't really salvage that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't stop, either?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?! In the middle of the ocean? Why?! That'd be daft! Good luck." Looks at Avantika, (singsong) "Good luck! With the missus," and turns around--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With the missus? Oh. The lady--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Dashilla.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika goes, "Don't pay him any mind. It is a "myth, and if it's not, well, we just finished tangling with a hydra and an entire island of snake "people. You're not seriously worried about a woman, eh?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we didn't fight them under the water.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have experience with this? Diving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I should have an answer to at least most of our troubles by the morrow. Just be patient."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes or no question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, most myths are based off of some sort of fact. We don't happen to know what the song thinks this dreadful creature is, do we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not any more than you would."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's an underwater banshee. For sure!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can't really sing underwater, so how's that work?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (underwater glubbing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love that everyone did that at the same time. That's all I needed. Well, great. We'll find this solution to the diving in the morning, and then in a day or two we'll make our way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is the idea."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you need any help securing this solution?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it's best I do it alone. It's more of a older business relationship. I don't want to make "him think that this is a, how do you say, untrustworthy trade, if you will."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, being that you'll be out, anything you need done for the ship or the crew while you're away, as your quartermaster?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, oversee the repairs to The Mistake, I believe they've begun before the night is over for "a bit. We probably will not need it for this endeavor, so it will begin and when we return from "Darktow it should be complete."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wonderful. All right. And your crew? Do I need to keep an eye on anyone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not in particular. They'll be looking around here, they'll be preparing. Gather their "materials, anything you think you require for the trip at sea go ahead and gather it, go amongst the "Sundry Square, purchase what is required, and then hopefully within the next 48 hours we'll be back "out on the waves."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 48 hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wonderful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's Allison been up to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drinking in the back, having a conversation with somebody and keeping one eye over at the table. Seems just perturbed. Not directly intent, but occasionally narrowing her eyes in the direction of Avantika.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would anyone care to join me for a stroll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, night walk?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That sounds like a great idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is good, if you are going to do a night walk alone, or together as a group is much better "than alone."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What should we be looking out for? Is there some sort of natural dangers, unnatural dangers?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Back corners, alleys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the laws say you're not to steal from another pirate in here, but only if they're caught."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I forgot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you totally could have gotten the stuff from that guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (frustrated noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But there are others out there perhaps who see fresh faces and think, well, easy prey. Best "not to cause a huge commotion immediately after arriving. Nobody does that, right?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely wouldn't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who would be so foolish? Little would they know, they'd be tangling with Avantika's crew, and that's something they don't want to mess with, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good eve."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bon soir.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she gets up, some of the rest of the crew stands up, you see Bouldergut in the back stand up as soon as the captain stands up, and goes like, "We going?" "Come on, this way." Walks by, puts her hand on your shoulder, and into your ear, Fjord, as she whispers, she goes, "I'm staying "upstairs, second room on the left," and leaves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did any of us see that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's a bad roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You see everything, why are you even rolling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It feels pretty public.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got fucking Mad-Eye Moody's eye where it's on me the whole time and the other one's doing its own thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, Caduceus, just from his passive perception, has seen this. What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of her crew slowly gets up, and some of them stay to drink, some of them go out to find their way in the night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need to pee. Anyone know where the bathroom is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty sure it's anywhere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do recall, walking through the city, a number of individuals stopping at the edge of the docks and pissing into the ocean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In Halfling I will say to Beauregard: Hey, don't you think we should go talk to that Allison person?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was already on it, I respond back in Halfling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I tag along?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a pen and paper I could borrow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She asks in Halfling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't understand what--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, got caught in a language loop. Do you have any pencil and paper, or pen and ink?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Well, of course I do, I always have a lot of stuff on me, here you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just like a scrap, thank you. I scribble, "Meet in the alley" on the piece of paper. Is there an alley? I'm assuming there's an alley behind this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no streets, it's all alleys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's entirely crafted of alleys. No, I mean, it's not very jam-packed around this particular tavern/inn, but there are some nearby buildings where there are alleys. This place is surrounded by streets because it's right there on the front near the shipyard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Meet in the back alley." To be specific.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vague directions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and what do you do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Will you go with me to the ladies' room so we can powder our noses together?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I love a good powder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go powder. As I walk out, I shake Alice's hand, say: Nice to meet you. And palm her the piece of paper that's folded very tightly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get a closer look at her, there's this heavy scar over one eye that keeps the eye mostly closed. You can see there looks to be a ruined eye beneath there that's healed over and is not functional. She wears it proudly as a point of intimidation or at least a badge of whatever gave her that scar. As she pulls back a little bit, her other hand going towards the dagger on the side that's now revealed from behind her coat. You palm her the note and she looks and takes it--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give her a wink and walk off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She crumples it with a terse look and lets it fall to the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh! Cold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go-- and I walk out. She'll read it, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's the bathroom?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to get some air.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ridiculous.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We just walked across the whole place. I haven't seen the bathroom once.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go around to the side of the building.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh? We're just going to take a shit in the alley?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are a hundred percent going to take a shit in the alley.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here comes the fanart. I hope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The heavy mist has fallen across Darktow and you can barely see beyond the outskirts of the city where the ocean begins. You can still hear the waters coming in against the rocks on the outside of the island, but you cannot actually see where the water connects. Beyond that, you can see the outline of the ship masts that are set at the end of the shipyard that are vanishing into the mist that surround you. What do you do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go towards the back "alley".

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You find what would be considered an alley behind the Inn and Tavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I show Nott where to take a shit. I wait either for the rest of my friends or for Alice to eventually read the damn thing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it Alice or Allison?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it was Allison.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Allison.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's on a nickname basis already.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because you called her the wrong name.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's like, "We're not there yet! We're not fucking Alice yet."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It works half of the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so pretty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's super awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If she comes out here, what are we going to say to her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just want to figure out what her beef is with Avantika. Maybe she can be our key--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But she's going to ask who we are. What do we tell her? That we're disgruntled members of her crew?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But she can turn us in! That's terrible. We should say that we're--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can get information from her first. We don't have to necessarily always give information upfront to get information and we can always lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not good at that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like that's slightly underhanded.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! It seems that way because I'm making a face because I'm halfway through a dump right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't break eye contact.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: We got this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! The hand touch! No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm ready.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe that is better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've reached a new level.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe that is better, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Nott) All right! I'm done! Hand me that dead cat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're welcome, Gary Gygax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are the rest of you doing? Caduceus, you went out for some fresh air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I went out. I'm standing by the front door, bouncer-like, and trying to get my bearings, take a look around, see what the vibe of this place is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm come join him out front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm staring at this milk that I ordered and it's really disgusting. And I--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not going to drink that, are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it has lumps in it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Well, it's a lumpy place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You doing okay? You seem a little off to me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? I seem off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you seem distracted around this woman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I just, well--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't like her very much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, is it because she's a murderer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. I don't like that part about her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but we're all kind of murderers sometimes, aren't we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that all of us are murderers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you a murderer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, we have killed some people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Murder is premeditated. That's a very different thing. I find it hard to believe that you have killed someone with premeditation. I could be wrong but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I don't. I haven't ever done that. I've done some pretty shady stuff though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you done some shady stuff?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I have.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you done stuff that's pirate-y before you were a pirate?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Sort of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's the shadiest thing you ever did?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Well, Nott and I have robbed people for sure. People with not a lot of money so that we can eat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's okay, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That did that we did to you when we first met you. You know, we turn one thing into another and then we go stay at an inn and buy food and then it turns back into pennies and that's not so good, but when you're starving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it is a really cool trick. They got to see magic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They didn't know it, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. It all balances out. You've done really good things, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want some of this lumpy milk?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Do you want any ale?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boy, this is quite a predicament that we've gotten ourselves into. How the hell-- we were visiting your mother. Your mother was so lovely--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! She's so nice! And now we're pirates and I'm never going to see her again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's really possible, Caleb. What if we can never go home?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll get you home. We're here-- this is Fjord's thing. We're his support. We're here to help him out. Beauregard and I don't want to be here forever either, I don't think. I know that I do not want to be in this place or on the sea forever. It's interesting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott definitely doesn't want to be in the sea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's like a cat on a hot tin roof.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think Caduceus doesn't like the water, either basically because it tried to kill him a few times already.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Really none of us like it here but Fjord, kind of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't even know if he likes it a lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's parts of it that he likes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like Avantika.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. You're sweet on him, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It feels funny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. You know, when you really like somebody, but then you start to know them, and you go, "Do I like them or do I like what I thought they were?" and then you don't know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you think that they are flirting with you, but then you found out that probably weren't, you know?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or just saving your life.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you feel kind of sad about it and maybe a little stupid.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a little out of my realm of experience. I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You had a girlfriend before though, yeah? (whispering) You said her name when we were dancing and then I put you to sleep and you said her name again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't forget anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was she pretty?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was handsome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was she a boy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I said she.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was handsome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm trying to get an image of her in my brain here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did she have like a really good nose or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The best.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're mysterious, Caleb, you know that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a long time ago, anyway. Let's just focus on getting out of this place away from that woman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And now she's saying we all have to take the same boat. How are we going to get away from her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anyone paying attention to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are you guys talking?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just literally right there at the table.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or like just leaning in a table together very low. Elf. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The crowd is pretty vibrant around here. A quick glance around you, you don't see anybody specifically paying attention or interested.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I don't care. I'm pulling out the wire and I'm putting it in my mouth. We'll take care of her if we have to. (coughing)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, just a cough. A cold. I want to get the hell off this island eventually, but we're here now. Tomorrow--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tomorrow, we find some books!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes! We'll find-- no. Probably not. But we'll get sorted. We'll make the best of this place. We'll help Fjord figure out his shit, I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's important to him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Then we'll get out of here and then you can reassess back on dry land.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Thanks, Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks for not leaving me on the street like a drunk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (giggles) I thought about it. It would have been pretty funny for you to wake up, but I like you more than that. Are we sleeping on our boat? Where should I go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we'll probably going to get a room somewhere here. Is this place an inn or a tavern? I did not even look coming in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing now, looking through the back, there is this staircase that winds up to a secondary floor and it looks like there probably is lodging.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did Avantika leave or did she go up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Avantika left for the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll have to secure the things--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Probably to shit in an alleyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're up front, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sitting out front. I'm doing the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you guys doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess just sitting in here for a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just drinking until--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put my hand on Caduceus' shoulder. How you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm doing all right. I'm just contemplating where we're going from here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You seemed a little more at ease. I'll lean in a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am a little more at ease.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do much drinking in there? I'm not really getting the fumes on your breath.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've only gotten drunk once in my life.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And that was because of Nott.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a reason for that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought I'd try. It didn't agree with me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happens when you drink?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything hurts and it's violently offensive to the body on every level. That stuff's disgusting. Just awful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you have stuff in your cup, right? You don't have to fake it. You can just--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, it feels polite and not everybody is as understanding as your friends, you know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just sit in the corner and I listen to everything that I can for as long as I can and it got a little noisy in there and thought I'd get a little air.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything popping up on that special radar of yours?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah. This place is dangerous. She's dangerous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. That she is. Should we grab the others and go explore for a bit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a good idea. And Fjord? You know why everybody's doing this. Why we're all here, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. I mean, I think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you know it. I just want to point it because that woman, she doesn't care what any of us want. I'm sure she'd be interested, but it's way low on her priorities and I don't trust anybody who puts other people's needs that low on the list, and you should keep mind of that while you're getting in bed with them, so to speak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is anybody out here in earshot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Outside at the moment? No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, listen. About that. Let's just keep it right between the amigos, all right? Just because--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What part of the body is the amigos?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. That's us, right? One amigo, two amigo. You and I are amigos.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'll be our thing. Like we're bunkees. We share--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Amigos. We share amigos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. We're not going to share amigos. We are the amigos.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's even better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sharing amigos is a whole other-- yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I get it. I'm not going to talk out of turn and I trust your intentions, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, actually, that's kind of what I wanted to talk to you about. You're real good at picking up on little things, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're asking if I can tell you're conflicted?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Heh, no, I think that's pretty clear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You'd be amazed, but all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just letting you know I'm trying to keep her close. I feel like this whole thing's getting a little out of sorts and the best way to keep a small finger on the pulse of things is to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a good man, Fjord, so be careful, because I imagine it's a little out of character being honest and truthful with somebody in a deceptive way. It can muddle a good man up whereas it doesn't muddle a bad man up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Haven't been very good at it so far.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's one of the reasons why I like you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here for you, man. I've been learning to swim.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, more of that to come. Where's the rest of these chuckle-fucks?
